department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography:
Professional Summary:
I started my career as a Mechanical Engineer and as an engineer, worked in government defense, the automotive industry and packaging industry.  I decided to change careers to explore the mathematics and programming that I enjoyed as an engineer.  I currently work in the trading and finance industry as a software engineer.  I had the unique opportunity to work abroad in Singapore to build out back office systems for a new office and new trade in Asia. 

Education:
*Master of Science in Computational Finance, DePaul University, Chicago, IL 2012
*Master of Science in Mathematics, Loyola University, Chicago, IL 2001
*B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, North Carolina A & T State University, Greensboro, NC 1994
